Ещё одна часть Half Life 2.Захватывающий сюжет,ну и ачивки))Концовка очень разачировала :с.В остальном всё хорошо,в отличии от 1 эпизода всё ясно,понятно.Поэтому 9.9/10.
Epic
An amazing game series continues.

My favourite FPS ever

It is a masterpiece in game design. The levels are as always, wonderfully crafted by Valve. The sound and visual design is epic creating a lifelike world with a rich story which sucks you in thanks to its wonderful characters and great voice acting.
Valve uses nearly every element of an FPS so you're never constantly faced with shooting gallerys like other FPS. The vehicle sections are a big improvement over the last games and they have some of the most fun to be had within the game.

This is a must have for any FPS fan

Valve, por dios, cómo nos dejas con la duda sobre el futuro de Half-Life!
Porque este juego es espectacular, un 10 en acción e historia, pero te deja con ansias de más al final.
A ver si llega Half-Life 3!
uhhhh so depressing sooo sad and such a great story but still waiting for half life3

Ce jeu est bourré d'action et de révélation a propos des conseillers.
Il y a des moments de jois et des moments de tristesses.
Comme beaucoup le font, je ne considère pas Half Life 2: Episode One et Episode Two comme des Gros DLC.
Je les considères comme des jeux qui suivent Half Life 2 en les commençant et en les finissant.

The Epic conclusion to the last Half-Life Episode that we know of that ... (SPOILER ALERT) ... Left all of us fans on a Huge cliff-hanger end when Alyx's dad tragically died from the Advisors. Yet since it was left on a huge cliff-hanger we can expect a dramatic change of graphics, detail, and effects when Half-Life 3 or Half-Life 2 Episode 3 ever comes out. 10/10 as always and this was my first time playing Half-Life since everyone in the fucking world has told me how good it was, and i must say, it beats Halo's story in some ways. You will enjoy this game. Thank You Gabe Newell and friends for a overall great experience. We still need more Half-Life though lol.

Great game and sequel to the first episode of Half-Life 2. The setting outside of City 17 was very nice, and the ambushes and new enemies we get to face and engage create a really cinematic and great experience. I also enjoyed the character development, and that little cliffhanger at the end really makes me want to exact revenge on the Combine. It was really worth the weight.

This is the best racing game ever! There's a story, but it gets in the way of driving sections. There's only one race, where you race this "Dog" thing, it's a fun race but it's missing music, so I played my own. DAAAAYYYYYTOOOONNNNNAAAA is the song I played while racing. My biggist compaints were that you don't gaet the car until much later and it handles like sh*t. Also for some reason you shoot things, and there's a story, I don't get. I also wish there's free roam, but something about some Sauce engine limits or whatever. Overall, I give it a, G4b3n/3.

Больше, лучше, краше, эпичнее первого эпизода, но всё равно слишком коротко. Пробежал почти за 5 часов (со всеми достижениями) на одном дыхании.
Советую брать только со всеми предыдущими вторыми частями и проходить по порядку, хотя, всё равно, после прохождения этого будет мало.

Jogo incrível, assim como o principal e o Episode One, com um final muito triste e chocante, o que eu e outras milhões de pessoas querem saber o que acontece depois. Valve, já passou da hora de ter a continuação, vocês não acham? Tantos fãs querendo saber o destino dos personagens. Mesmo que o próximo seja o último jogo da franquia, mas pelo menos vamos saber o que acontece após o fim do Episode Two.
Espero ansiosamente pelo Episode Three/ Half Life 3. Quem nunca jogou, recomendo demais jogar desde o HL2 até o Episode Two, a história é ótima e os personagens são super carismáticos.

Here's the moment that it all comes to life: you finally get to play along a vortigaunt that blasts enemies away like in the original Half-life and it all leads to an epic fight that combines driving and shooting perfectly, à la GTA or probably even better, and it all leads up too, hmm, nothingness. Like with SIN: EPISODES, the final chapter was never released. I guess we have to settle for that, at least we got some decent fights with some new enemies (the hunters and acid antlings), but I do wonder why the episodic games using the Source engine never got finished...

You'll never see how it ends

Half-Life 2: Episode Two – продолжение истории Half-Life 2, повествующее о событиях, произошедших после Episode One, вторая игра, являющаяся частью эпизодической системы сюжета Half-Life 2.
В техническом плане Episode Two выше своих предшественниц. Физический движок научился сращивать математические расчеты с заранее созданной анимацией, что наглядно демонстрируют крушение железнодорожного моста в первой главе и взорванные домики — в предпоследней. Графический — освоил мультиядерные процессоры, «motion blur», глубину резкости кадра и честные «мягкие» тени от фонарика (но их почему-то отбрасывают не все объекты). Музыка, пролетавшая мимо ушей в Half-Life 2 стала агрессивнее и богаче за счет более мощного ритма и звучных электрогитар.
Характерной чертой, которая отличает этот эпизод от предыдущего и вообще от всех частей серии Half-Life, является то, что большая часть игрового процесса происходит в лесах, на открытых местностях.
Парочка свежих монстров и большое разнообразие знакомых ситуаций и декораций, в отличие от Episode One (где единственной новинкой были «зомбайны»). И, несмотря на то, что Episode Two оставляет приятное впечатление (за вычетом битвы со страйдерами, в которой побеждает не умение, а «quickload»), голову не покидает тревожная мысль: неужели в третьей «серии» нам опять предложат полное дежа вю, да еще без новых видов оружия?
Плюсы:
Отличный сюжет и атмосфера
Запоминающиеся боевые сцены
Динамичные поездки на авто
Общая насыщенность событиями
Похорошевшая графика, AI, анимация, звуки
Минусы:
Короткая кампания
Затянутое ползанье по подземельям
Отсутствие новшеств в игровой механике
An EPIC continuation to the great story, and of course, an amazing ending that will leave you waiting for episode 3

I am just going to say this right now. I really loved this game. This is going to be a long review as well. Just sayin'.

Now, I do have reasons to say so. I personally disliked Half-Life 2, and Half-Life 2 Episode 1. Still buy them, because to get the full experience of Episode 2 you need to know not only the story, but how much the game improved.

Now, the entire Half-Life 1 (classic?) series was great, while sometimes buggy. What can I say? Golden Source is golden. The gameplay was smooth, the weapons were nice and powerfull-ish, and you played as a variety of characters.

(STILL BUY THIS GAME! SKIP IF YOU DON'T LIKE CRITICISM) Here is where Half-Lfe 2 comes in. Gordon Freeman in a City 17 train, waiting with the rest of the ctizens. Commence with an overly long section without even a crowbar, picking up and throwing spare junk. A little while after, you spend way too long speeding around in an airboat. Then the Gravity Gun, to pick up and throw even more spare junk, but at high speeds. A dunebuggy with suspension level ten thousand, not to mention two types of portable infinite ammo. Last but not least, the 1500 Megawatt Black Mesa Heavy Duty Super-Colliding Super Gravity Gun. One last way to run around with over 9000 HEV and the one weapon to rule them all. The NPCs in the game? "Oh, Gordon Freeman. We worship you, even though you basically caused this whole mess and only saved yourself." Barney Calhoun, the dropout hero of Blue Shift? "Headhumper. Headhumper. Hey, I finally took one down!"

All of these were fun, but too drawn-out. No offense to Valve, but the majority of gamers can learn how to use a gimmick in much less time than otherwise thought. Overall, Half-Life 2 had long expanses of nothing, but in reality some of the best  gameplay experiences I've ever had.

(SERIOUSLY, STILL BUY THIS GAME! YOU, THE READER, HAVE THE POWER TO SKIP AT ANY TIME!) Half-Lide 2 Episode 1. Where do I begin? Morg- Gordon Freeman wakes up, and for some reason goes right back into the Citadel. Here he aquires the Conveniently Temporary Over-Powered Blue Zero-Point Energy Manipulator. I didn't think highly of this game from up front, remembering the whimper in which Half-Life 2 ended. From here on,  The gameplay is mostly indoors with airducts, similar to Half-Life 1. But, the story was meh. To add, Alyx's AI walked right up to every enemy, and died too often. The fights were really intense, though. All being said, the game kind of ended after about three hours and one strider.

Overall verdict: intense, even difficult action, but compressed into too little time, squeezing out story.

vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv
Half-Life 2 Episode 2. This game is EXCELLENT. If I can say this to the entirety of Steam after knocking the rest of Half-Life 2, I must mean something. Gordon now wakes up inside of the train that crashed. As the train slowly topples over, the obstacle course that you need to climb down changes. I also happen to love changing terrain, so good first impression. Now I begin to notice things. The flashlight that wore out in about ten seconds in the other games was replaced with one much more similar to Half-Life 1. Also on an individual battery, allowing you to dash for more than a few seconds. I gaze deeply into my teammate's eyes, she awkwardly turns away to avoid eye contact. Very human of her. The car is come-and-go. You can struggle through most areas either with or without the car. It lasted just as long as it was needed. and no longer. As for action, there was never a point without it. All was unique, as well. Half-Life 2 got stale, while Episode 1 was overwhelming. Episode 2 managed to get just the right mix of the two, combining into THE perfect balance. Rochelle- I mean, Alyx's AI was realistic, even to the level of the player. Then there's the Gnome. My good friend the Garden Gnome. As a display of how much Valve in the greatest compaby on this side of the universe, you get an achievement for carrying this guy through almost the whole game. While a pain as some points, I kind of grew to like the guy. The ALyx Vance mauled by a Hunter? "Don't look, Gnome. Shield thou purest of eyes." It's a showcase of how great the gameplay is. You literally could have taken ANY item throughout the entire game. Now, back on topic. The Characters were recovered to what they should have been. Barney as a security guard. Refugees as refugees. The vortigaunts actually using their green electricity bolts. The characters were essential to the rich storyline. The storyline alone could have made a movie, as it was what made me start rooting for Half-Life 3. Basically, every problem that I have found in any other Half-Life game was remedied in this one fantastic sequel.
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
